items.example: **I usually** wake up at 7 in the morning.
**I usually** have coffee for breakfast.
**I usually** go to bed around 11 PM.
**I usually** take the subway to work.
**I** exercise every day.
**I** go to the gym every week.
**I** meet my friends every weekend.
**I** clean my room every Sunday.
items.translation: 나는 매주 일요일에 방 청소를 해요.

items.example: **I like to** watch movies.
**I like to** listen to music.
**I like to** cook Korean food.
items.translation: 나는 한국 음식 요리하는 것을 좋아해요.

items.example: **I like to** travel to new places.
items.translation: 나는 새로운 곳으로 여행하는 것을 좋아해요.

items.example: **I like** watching Netflix.
**I like** hanging out with friends.
**I like** eating out on weekends.
**I like** playing video games.
**I want to** learn English.
**I want to** travel abroad.
**I want to** get a better job.
items.translation: 나는 더 좋은 직장을 얻고 싶어요.

items.example: **I want to** improve my speaking skills.
**I need to** finish my work.
**I need to** wake up early tomorrow.
**I need to** save more money.
**I need to** exercise more.
**I have to** go to work early.
**I have to** study for the exam.
**I have to** take care of my parents.
**I have to** submit the report by Friday.
**There is** a park near my house.
There are many restaurants in my neighborhood.
**There is** a gym in my apartment building.
There are a lot of things to do in Seoul.
**It takes** about 30 minutes to get to work.
**It takes** an hour to cook dinner.
items.translation: 저녁을 요리하는 데 한 시간 걸려요.

items.example: **It takes** two hours to watch the movie.
items.translation: 영화를 보는 데 두 시간 걸려요.

items.example: **It takes** a long time to learn a language.
items.translation: 언어를 배우는 데 오랜 시간이 걸려요.

items.example: **I** went to the movies yesterday.
**I** traveled to Jeju last month.
**I** started this job two years ago.
**I** met my friend last weekend.
**I have been to** Japan three times.
**I have been to** that restaurant before.
I have never been to Europe.
**I have been to** many countries in Asia.
**I have** tried that food before.
**I have** seen that movie before.
**I have** used this app before.
**I have** experienced something similar before.
**I'm going to** meet my friends this weekend.
items.translation: 나는 이번 주말에 친구들을 만날 거예요.

items.example: **I'm going to** travel to Europe next year.
items.translation: 나는 내년에 유럽으로 여행 갈 거예요.

items.example: **I'm going to** start exercising tomorrow.
**I'm going to** change my job soon.
**I will** do my best.
**I will** try harder next time.
**I will** let you know later.
**I will** keep practicing English.
**I'm planning to** buy a new car.
**I'm planning to** move to a bigger apartment.
items.translation: 나는 더 큰 아파트로 이사할 계획이에요.

items.example: **I'm planning to** take a vacation next month.
items.translation: 나는 다음 달에 휴가를 갈 계획이에요.

items.example: **I'm planning to** study abroad.
**I used to** play soccer when I was young.
items.translation: 나는 어렸을 때 축구를 하곤 했어요.

items.example: **I used to** live in Busan.
**I used to** eat fast food a lot.
**I used to** be very shy.
**I used to** work at a big company.
**I used to** watch TV a lot, but now I prefer reading.
items.translation: 나는 TV를 많이 봤었는데, 지금은 독서를 선호해요.

items.example: **I would often** go hiking with my dad.
items.translation: 나는 종종 아빠와 등산을 가곤 했어요.

items.example: **I would often** stay up late studying.
**I would often** hang out with my friends after school.
items.translation: 나는 종종 방과 후에 친구들과 어울리곤 했어요.

items.example: **I would often** visit my grandparents during summer vacation.
items.translation: 나는 종종 여름방학 때 조부모님을 방문하곤 했어요.

patterns.name: When I was young/a kid, I + 과거동사

items.example: **When I was young**, I lived in a small town.
items.translation: 내가 어렸을 때, 작은 마을에서 살았어요.

items.example: When I was a kid, I loved playing outside.
items.translation: 내가 어렸을 때, 밖에서 노는 것을 좋아했어요.

items.example: When I was in high school, I was on the basketball team.
When I was a university student, I worked part-time.
Cooking at home is more economical than eating out.
items.translation: 집에서 요리하는 것이 외식보다 더 경제적이에요.

items.example: Summer is more popular than winter for traveling.
items.translation: 여행하기에는 겨울보다 여름이 더 인기 있어요.

items.example: Living in the city is more convenient than living in the countryside.
items.translation: 도시에 사는 것이 시골에 사는 것보다 더 편리해요.

items.example: Online shopping is less stressful than going to stores.
items.translation: 온라인 쇼핑이 매장에 가는 것보다 덜 스트레스받아요.

items.example: This restaurant is not as crowded as that one.
items.translation: 이 레스토랑은 저 레스토랑만큼 붐비지 않아요.

items.example: Today is not as cold as yesterday.
This movie is not as interesting as I expected.
items.translation: 이 영화는 제가 기대한 만큼 재미있지 않아요.

items.example: My new job is not as stressful as my old one.
items.translation: 새 직장은 전 직장만큼 스트레스받지 않아요.

items.example: **Compared to** before, I exercise more now.
**Compared to** my friends, I'm more introverted.
Unlike the past, people now work from home more often.
items.translation: 과거와 달리, 지금은 사람들이 더 자주 재택근무를 해요.

items.example: Unlike my parents, I prefer city life.
items.translation: 부모님과 달리, 저는 도시 생활을 선호해요.

items.example: **The reason** I like this place is because it's quiet.
items.translation: 제가 이곳을 좋아하는 이유는 조용하기 때문이에요.

items.example: **The reason** why I chose this job is that I'm passionate about it.
items.translation: 제가 이 직업을 선택한 이유는 열정이 있기 때문이에요.

items.example: **The reason** I started exercising is because I wanted to be healthier.
items.translation: 제가 운동을 시작한 이유는 더 건강해지고 싶었기 때문이에요.

items.example: **The reason** why I prefer coffee is that it keeps me awake.
items.translation: 제가 커피를 선호하는 이유는 잠을 깨게 해주기 때문이에요.

items.example: **That's why** I decided to change my job.
**That's why** I like living in this neighborhood.
items.translation: 그래서 이 동네에 사는 것이 좋아요.

items.example: **That's why** I started learning English.
**That's why** I always go to that restaurant.
I was late because of the traffic.
I couldn't go out because of the rain.
I changed my plan because of work.
I love this city because of its culture.
The event was canceled due to the weather.
I was tired due to lack of sleep.
The delay was due to technical problems.
Sales increased due to the new marketing strategy.
**I think** English is important for my career.
**I think** traveling is a great way to learn about other cultures.
items.translation: 여행은 다른 문화를 배우는 좋은 방법이라고 생각해요.

items.example: **I think** we should try the new restaurant.
items.translation: 새 레스토랑을 가봐야 할 것 같아요.

items.example: **I think** this is a good opportunity.
**In my opinion**, reading is more beneficial than watching TV.
items.translation: 제 생각에는 독서가 TV 보는 것보다 더 유익해요.

items.example: **In my opinion**, this is the best restaurant in town.
items.translation: 제 생각에 이곳이 동네에서 최고의 레스토랑이에요.

items.example: **In my opinion**, work-life balance is very important.
items.translation: 제 생각에 일과 삶의 균형은 매우 중요해요.

items.example: **In my opinion**, technology has made our lives easier.
items.translation: 제 생각에 기술이 우리 삶을 더 편리하게 만들었어요.

items.example: **I believe** that hard work pays off.
**I believe** learning English will help my career.
items.translation: 영어를 배우면 제 경력에 도움이 될 거라고 믿어요.

items.example: **I believe** everyone should exercise regularly.
items.translation: 모든 사람이 규칙적으로 운동해야 한다고 생각해요.

items.example: **I believe** this experience was valuable.
**I feel like** eating pizza tonight.
**I feel like** staying home today.
**I feel like** I need a vacation.
**I feel like** something is missing.

patterns.name: I prefer A to B / I prefer A over B

items.example: I prefer coffee to tea.
I prefer watching movies at home to going to the theater.
items.translation: 저는 극장에 가는 것보다 집에서 영화 보는 것을 선호해요.

items.example: I prefer working alone over working in a team.
items.translation: 저는 팀으로 일하는 것보다 혼자 일하는 것을 선호해요.

items.example: I prefer summer over winter.

patterns.name: I would rather + 동사원형 + than + 동사원형

items.example: **I would rather** stay home than go out in this weather.
items.translation: 이 날씨에 나가느니 차라리 집에 있겠어요.

items.example: **I would rather** cook than order delivery.
**I would rather** walk than take the bus.
**I would rather** save money than spend it on luxury items.
**I have become** more confident over the years.
**I have become** more interested in cooking.
**I have become** healthier since I started exercising.
**I have become** more patient as I got older.

patterns.name: It has changed a lot since ~

items.example: My neighborhood has changed a lot since I was a kid.
items.translation: 내가 어렸을 때 이후로 동네가 많이 변했어요.

items.example: Technology has changed a lot since the 2000s.
My lifestyle has changed a lot since I started working.
items.translation: 일을 시작한 이후로 생활 방식이 많이 변했어요.

items.example: Things have changed a lot since the pandemic.

patterns.name: ~ is not the same as it used to be

items.example: This neighborhood is not the same as it used to be.
Life is not the same as it used to be.
The company is not the same as it used to be.
My routine is not the same as it used to be.

patterns.name: If I had + 과거분사, I would have + 과거분사

items.example: **If I had** studied harder, I would have gotten a better grade.
items.translation: 더 열심히 공부했더라면, 더 좋은 성적을 받았을 텐데.

items.example: **If I had** known about it earlier, I would have told you.
items.translation: 더 일찍 알았더라면, 당신에게 말했을 텐데.

items.example: **If I had** saved more money, I would have bought a house.
items.translation: 돈을 더 모았더라면, 집을 샀을 텐데.

items.example: **If I had** taken that job, my life would have been different.
items.translation: 그 직장을 가졌더라면, 제 인생이 달랐을 텐데.

patterns.name: If I were ~, I would + 동사원형

items.example: **If I were** rich, I would travel around the world.
**If I were** you, I would take that opportunity.
items.translation: 내가 당신이라면, 그 기회를 잡을 텐데.

items.example: **If I were** younger, I would learn more languages.
items.translation: 더 젊었다면, 더 많은 언어를 배울 텐데.

items.example: **If I were** in charge, I would change the policy.

patterns.name: I wish I + 과거동사 / had + 과거분사

items.example: **I wish I** had more time.
**I wish I** could speak English fluently.
items.translation: 영어를 유창하게 말할 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

items.example: **I wish I** had studied abroad when I was younger.
items.translation: 어렸을 때 유학을 갔더라면 좋았을 텐데.

items.example: **I wish I** had listened to my parents' advice.

patterns.name: ~ has had a big impact on ~

items.example: Technology has had a big impact on our daily lives.
items.translation: 기술이 우리 일상에 큰 영향을 미쳤어요.

items.example: My parents have had a big impact on who I am today.
items.translation: 부모님이 현재의 저에게 큰 영향을 미쳤어요.

items.example: This experience has had a big impact on my career.
items.translation: 이 경험이 제 경력에 큰 영향을 미쳤어요.

items.example: Social media has had a big impact on how we communicate.
items.translation: 소셜 미디어가 우리의 의사소통 방식에 큰 영향을 미쳤어요.

patterns.name: As a result, ~ / Because of this, ~

items.example: I practiced every day. As a result, I improved a lot.
items.translation: 매일 연습했어요. 그 결과 많이 향상됐어요.

items.example: I saved money for years. Because of this, I could buy a house.
items.translation: 몇 년간 돈을 모았어요. 그래서 집을 살 수 있었어요.

items.example: I worked hard. As a result, I got promoted.
I made a mistake. Because of this, I learned an important lesson.
items.translation: 실수를 했어요. 그래서 중요한 교훈을 얻었어요.

patterns.name: This led to + 명사 / This led me to + 동사원형

items.example: **This led to** a big change in my life.
items.translation: 이것이 제 인생의 큰 변화로 이어졌어요.

items.example: This led me to reconsider my career choices.
items.translation: 이것이 제 진로 선택을 재고하게 했어요.

items.example: My experience abroad led to my interest in languages.
items.translation: 해외 경험이 언어에 대한 관심으로 이어졌어요.

items.example: This led me to become more independent.
**What happened was** that I missed my flight.
**What happened was** I forgot my wallet at home.
items.translation: 무슨 일이 있었냐면 집에 지갑을 두고 왔어요.

items.example: **What happened was** that the meeting was canceled at the last minute.
items.translation: 무슨 일이 있었냐면 회의가 마지막 순간에 취소됐어요.

items.example: **What happened was** my phone died, so I couldn't call anyone.
items.translation: 무슨 일이 있었냐면 폰 배터리가 나가서 아무에게도 전화할 수 없었어요.

items.example: **The thing is**, I wasn't prepared for it.
**The thing is** that I've never done this before.
**The thing is**, I didn't have enough time.
**The thing is** that it's not as easy as it looks.
**What I mean is** that we need more time.
items.translation: 내 말은 시간이 더 필요하다는 거예요.

items.example: **What I mean is**, it's not just about money.
items.translation: 내 말은, 단순히 돈 문제가 아니라는 거예요.

items.example: **What I mean is** that quality is more important than quantity.
items.translation: 내 말은 양보다 질이 더 중요하다는 거예요.

items.example: **What I mean is** we should focus on the main issue.
items.translation: 내 말은 주요 문제에 집중해야 한다는 거예요.

patterns.name: I'm not sure, but I think ~

items.example: **I'm not sure**, but I think the movie starts at 7.
items.translation: 확실하지 않지만 영화가 7시에 시작하는 것 같아요.

items.example: **I'm not sure**, but I think we met before.
items.translation: 확실하지 않지만 우리 전에 만난 것 같아요.

items.example: **I'm not sure**, but I think this is the right way.
items.translation: 확실하지 않지만 이게 맞는 길인 것 같아요.

items.example: **I'm not sure**, but I think it will rain tomorrow.
items.translation: 확실하지 않지만 내일 비가 올 것 같아요.

items.example: This might be a good opportunity.
It could be more expensive than we expected.
items.translation: 우리 예상보다 더 비쌀 수도 있어요.

items.example: He might be busy right now.
This could be the reason why it happened.
items.translation: 이것이 그 일이 일어난 이유일 수도 있어요.

patterns.name: It seems like / It looks like ~

items.example: **It seems like** everyone is busy these days.
It looks like it's going to rain.
**It seems like** this is a popular restaurant.
items.translation: 여기가 인기 있는 레스토랑인 것 같아요.

items.example: It looks like we're lost.
**Even though** I was tired, I finished the project.
Although it was raining, we went hiking.
**Even though** it was expensive, it was worth it.
Although I've been here for a year, I still don't know the area well.
items.translation: 여기 온 지 1년이 됐지만, 아직 이 지역을 잘 몰라요.

items.example: **Despite** the bad weather, we had a great time.
items.translation: 날씨가 안 좋았지만, 좋은 시간을 보냈어요.

items.example: **Despite** being tired, I couldn't sleep.
**Despite** the challenges, I didn't give up.
**Despite** having little experience, I got the job.
I wanted to go. However, I was too busy.
The food was good. The service was slow, though.
It was challenging. It was rewarding, however.
I was nervous. I did my best, though.

patterns.name: What I really like/love about ~ is ~

items.example: **What I really like** about my job is the flexible hours.
items.translation: 제 직장에서 정말 좋은 점은 유연한 근무시간이에요.

items.example: What I love about this city is the food.
items.translation: 이 도시에서 정말 좋은 점은 음식이에요.

items.example: **What I really like** about traveling is meeting new people.
items.translation: 여행에서 정말 좋은 점은 새로운 사람들을 만나는 거예요.

items.example: What I love about my neighborhood is how quiet it is.
items.translation: 제 동네에서 좋은 점은 얼마나 조용한지예요.

items.example: **The best** thing about working from home is saving commute time.
items.translation: 재택근무의 가장 좋은 점은 출퇴근 시간을 아끼는 거예요.

items.example: The worst thing about my job is the long hours.
items.translation: 제 직업의 가장 나쁜 점은 긴 근무시간이에요.

items.example: **The best** thing about living here is the convenient transportation.
items.translation: 여기 사는 것의 가장 좋은 점은 편리한 교통이에요.

items.example: The worst thing about the city is the air pollution.
**One thing I** learned is that patience is important.
items.translation: 제가 배운 한 가지는 인내가 중요하다는 거예요.

items.example: **One thing I** noticed is that people are very friendly here.
items.translation: 제가 느낀 한 가지는 여기 사람들이 매우 친절하다는 거예요.

items.example: **One thing I** regret is not traveling more when I was younger.
items.translation: 제가 후회하는 한 가지는 어렸을 때 더 많이 여행하지 않은 거예요.

items.example: **One thing I** appreciate is having supportive friends.
items.translation: 제가 감사하게 여기는 한 가지는 응원해주는 친구들이 있다는 거예요.

patterns.name: First, ~ / Then, ~ / After that, ~ / Finally, ~
patterns.meaning: 먼저 / 그 다음 / 그 후에 / 마지막으로

items.example: **First**, I wake up at 7. Then, I take a shower. After that, I have breakfast. Finally, I leave for work.
items.translation: 먼저, 7시에 일어나요. 그 다음, 샤워를 해요. 그 후에, 아침을 먹어요. 마지막으로, 출근해요.

items.example: **First**, we checked in. Then, we went to our room. After that, we explored the hotel. Finally, we went to dinner.
items.translation: 먼저, 체크인했어요. 그 다음, 방에 갔어요. 그 후에, 호텔을 둘러봤어요. 마지막으로, 저녁을 먹으러 갔어요.

items.example: **Once** I finish work, I go straight home.
items.translation: 일단 일이 끝나면, 바로 집에 가요.

items.example: **Once** you get used to it, it becomes easier.
**Once** I started exercising, I felt more energetic.
items.translation: 일단 운동을 시작하니, 더 활력이 넘쳤어요.

items.example: **Once** the rain stops, let's go out.
**As soon as** I got home, I fell asleep.
**As soon as** I saw the email, I replied immediately.
**As soon as** the movie ended, everyone left.
**As soon as** I heard the news, I called my friend.
**By the time** I arrived, the meeting had already started.
items.translation: 제가 도착했을 때쯤에는, 회의가 이미 시작됐어요.

items.example: **By the time** I finished, everyone had left.
**By the time** I realized my mistake, it was too late.
items.translation: 제가 실수를 깨달았을 때쯤에는, 너무 늦었어요.

items.example: **By the time** I got home, I was exhausted.
I'm a software engineer.
I work for a tech company.

items.pattern: I've been working as ~ for + 기간
items.example: I've been working as a developer for 5 years.
I'm in charge of the marketing team.
My main responsibility is managing projects.

items.pattern: I live in a + 주거형태 + in + 장소
items.example: I live in an apartment in Seoul.
My place is located near the subway station.

items.pattern: I've been living here for + 기간
items.example: I've been living here for 3 years.

items.pattern: The thing I like most about my place is ~
items.example: The thing I like most about my place is the view.
items.translation: 제 집에서 가장 좋은 점은 전망이에요.

items.example: My neighborhood is known for good restaurants.

items.pattern: In my free time, I like to ~
items.example: In my free time, I like to read books.
items.translation: 여가 시간에는 책 읽는 것을 좋아해요.

items.example: I got into photography about 2 years ago.
What I enjoy about hiking is the fresh air.
I've been playing guitar for 10 years.
Whenever I have time, I watch movies.

items.pattern: One of the best trips I've taken was to ~
items.example: One of the best trips I've taken was to Japan.
items.translation: 제가 했던 최고의 여행 중 하나는 일본 여행이에요.

items.pattern: What made the trip memorable was ~
items.example: What made the trip memorable was the beautiful scenery.
items.translation: 그 여행을 기억에 남게 한 것은 아름다운 풍경이에요.

items.example: I spent a week exploring the city.

items.pattern: The highlight of the trip was ~
items.example: The highlight of the trip was visiting the temple.

items.pattern: If I could go anywhere, I would go to ~
items.example: If I could go anywhere, I would go to Italy.
items.translation: 어디든 갈 수 있다면, 이탈리아에 갈 거예요.

items.example: My favorite food is Korean BBQ.
items.translation: 제가 가장 좋아하는 음식은 한국식 바베큐예요.

items.example: I'm a big fan of Italian food.

items.pattern: What I love about this dish is ~
items.example: What I love about this dish is the flavor.
I usually eat cereal for breakfast.
I can't resist chocolate cake.

items.pattern: I use ~ on a daily basis
items.example: I use my smartphone on a daily basis.

items.pattern: ~ has made my life easier because ~
items.example: Technology has made my life easier because I can work remotely.
items.translation: 기술 덕분에 재택근무가 가능해서 삶이 더 편해졌어요.

items.example: I couldn't live without my phone.

items.pattern: One app I use frequently is ~
items.example: One app I use frequently is YouTube.
items.translation: 자주 사용하는 앱 중 하나는 유튜브예요.

items.example: Technology helps me stay connected with friends.
items.translation: 기술은 친구들과 연락을 유지하는 데 도움이 돼요.

items.pattern: I ran into a problem when ~
items.example: I ran into a problem when my car broke down.
The issue was that I couldn't contact anyone.
items.translation: 문제는 아무에게도 연락할 수 없었다는 거예요.

items.pattern: I managed to + 해결방법 + by + 동명사
items.example: I managed to fix it by calling a mechanic.
In the end, everything worked out.

items.pattern: What I learned from this experience is ~
items.example: What I learned from this experience is to always have a backup plan.
items.translation: 이 경험에서 배운 것은 항상 대안을 준비해야 한다는 거예요.

items.example: **I try to** exercise at least three times a week.
items.translation: 일주일에 최소 세 번은 운동하려고 노력해요.

items.example: **I try to** eat healthy foods.
**I try to** get enough sleep every night.
items.translation: 매일 밤 충분한 수면을 취하려고 노력해요.

items.example: **I've been trying to** lose weight.
**I've been trying to** quit smoking.
**I've been trying to** drink more water.
**It's important to** stay active.
**It's important to** take breaks.
**It's important to** manage stress.

patterns.name: The best way to + 동사 + is to + 동사

items.example: **The best way to** stay healthy is to exercise regularly.
items.translation: 건강을 유지하는 가장 좋은 방법은 규칙적으로 운동하는 거예요.

items.example: **The best way to** relieve stress is to do something you enjoy.
items.translation: 스트레스를 해소하는 가장 좋은 방법은 좋아하는 것을 하는 거예요.

items.example: **The best way to** lose weight is to eat less and move more.
items.translation: 살을 빼는 가장 좋은 방법은 적게 먹고 많이 움직이는 거예요.

items.example: **I'm looking for** a birthday gift.
**I'm looking for** a new laptop.
**I'm looking for** something casual to wear.

patterns.name: Do you have + 명사 + in + 색상/사이즈?

items.example: **Do you have** this in a larger size?
**Do you have** this in blue?
**Do you have** this in stock?
**I'd like to return** this shirt.
I'd like to exchange this for a different size.
I'd like to get a refund.
**It's a good deal because** it's 50% off.
**It's a good deal because** you get free shipping.
**It's a good deal because** the quality is excellent.
**I love** spring because the weather is perfect.
**I love** summer because I can go to the beach.
items.translation: 해변에 갈 수 있어서 여름을 좋아해요.

items.example: **I love** fall because of the beautiful leaves.

patterns.name: When the weather is + 형용사, I like to ~

items.example: **When the weather is** nice, I like to go for a walk.
items.translation: 날씨가 좋을 때 산책하는 것을 좋아해요.

items.example: **When the weather is** cold, I like to stay indoors.
items.translation: 날씨가 추울 때 실내에 있는 것을 좋아해요.

items.example: **When the weather is** rainy, I like to read books at home.
items.translation: 비 오는 날씨일 때 집에서 책 읽는 것을 좋아해요.

patterns.name: It looks like it's going to + 동사/형용사

items.example: **It looks like it's going to** rain.
**It looks like it's going to** be a nice day.
**It looks like it's going to** get cold.
**Have you seen** the new Marvel movie?
**Have you seen** Squid Game?
**Have you seen** any good movies lately?
**The movie** is about a group of superheroes saving the world.
items.translation: 그 영화는 세계를 구하는 슈퍼히어로 그룹에 관한 거예요.

items.example: The drama is about a love story between two lawyers.
items.translation: 그 드라마는 두 변호사의 사랑 이야기예요.

items.example: The documentary is about climate change.
items.translation: 그 다큐멘터리는 기후 변화에 관한 거예요.

patterns.name: What I liked about it was ~

items.example: **What I liked about it was** the unexpected ending.
items.translation: 내가 좋았던 점은 예상치 못한 결말이에요.

items.example: **What I liked about it was** the amazing special effects.
items.translation: 내가 좋았던 점은 놀라운 특수 효과예요.

items.example: **What I liked about it was** the chemistry between the actors.
items.translation: 내가 좋았던 점은 배우들 간의 케미예요.

patterns.name: I would recommend it to + 사람

items.example: **I would recommend it to** anyone who likes action movies.
**I would recommend it to** people who enjoy romantic comedies.
**I would recommend it to** fans of Korean dramas.
**I'm really into** K-pop these days.
**I'm really into** jazz music.
**I'm really into** hip-hop lately.

patterns.name: I listen to music when I ~

items.example: **I listen to music when I** work out.
**I listen to music when I**'m stressed.
**I listen to music when I** commute to work.
BTS is my favorite band.
Taylor Swift is my favorite artist.
items.translation: 테일러 스위프트가 제가 가장 좋아하는 아티스트예요.

items.example: Coldplay is my all-time favorite band.
**I'm currently reading** a mystery novel.
**I'm currently reading** a self-help book.
**I'm currently reading** Harry Potter in English.
**I prefer** fiction because it sparks my imagination.
**I prefer** non-fiction because I like learning new things.
items.translation: 새로운 것을 배우는 걸 좋아해서 논픽션을 선호해요.

items.example: **I prefer** e-books because they're more convenient.

patterns.name: The book really made me think about ~

items.example: **The book really made me think about** my life goals.
items.translation: 그 책은 제 인생 목표에 대해 생각하게 만들었어요.

items.example: **The book really made me think about** society.
items.translation: 그 책은 사회에 대해 생각하게 만들었어요.

items.example: **The book really made me think about** relationships.
items.translation: 그 책은 인간관계에 대해 생각하게 만들었어요.

patterns.name: I've been playing + 스포츠 + for + 기간

items.example: **I've been playing** soccer for 10 years.
**I've been playing** tennis since high school.
**I've been playing** basketball since I was a kid.
**I enjoy watching** football games on TV.
items.translation: TV로 축구 경기 보는 것을 즐겨요.

items.example: **I enjoy watching** the Olympics.
**I enjoy watching** baseball with my friends.
**My favorite team is** Manchester United.
**My favorite team is** the LA Lakers.
**My favorite team is** the Korean national soccer team.
items.translation: 제가 좋아하는 팀은 한국 축구 국가대표팀이에요.

patterns.name: I work as a + 직업 + at + 회사/장소

items.example: **I work as a** software engineer at a tech company.
**I work as a** marketing manager at a startup.
**I work as a** teacher at a high school.
**My job involves** meeting with clients.
**My job involves** a lot of teamwork.
**My job involves** solving complex problems.
items.translation: 내 일은 복잡한 문제 해결을 포함해요.

patterns.name: What I like about my job is ~

items.example: **What I like about my job is** the flexible hours.
items.translation: 내 직업에서 좋은 점은 유연한 근무 시간이에요.

items.example: **What I like about my job is** the creative environment.
items.translation: 내 직업에서 좋은 점은 창의적인 환경이에요.

items.example: **What I like about my job is** working with talented people.
items.translation: 내 직업에서 좋은 점은 재능 있는 사람들과 일하는 거예요.

patterns.name: I'm planning to + 직업 관련 목표

items.example: **I'm planning to** get a promotion next year.
**I'm planning to** change careers.
**I'm planning to** start my own business.
**I'm studying** business at Seoul National University.
**I'm studying** computer science at a local college.
items.translation: 지역 대학에서 컴퓨터 과학을 전공하고 있어요.

items.example: I majored in English literature.
**I found** math challenging because of the complex formulas.
**I found** physics challenging because it requires abstract thinking.
**I found** learning a new language challenging at first.
items.translation: 처음에는 새 언어 배우는 게 어려웠어요.

patterns.name: The most memorable class I took was ~
patterns.meaning: 내가 들은 가장 기억에 남는 수업은 ~야

items.example: **The most memorable class I took was** public speaking.
items.translation: 내가 들은 가장 기억에 남는 수업은 대중 연설이에요.

items.example: **The most memorable class I took was** creative writing.
items.translation: 내가 들은 가장 기억에 남는 수업은 창작 글쓰기예요.

items.example: **The most memorable class I took was** psychology.
items.translation: 내가 들은 가장 기억에 남는 수업은 심리학이에요.

items.example: **I've known** my best friend for over 10 years.
items.translation: 내 가장 친한 친구를 10년 넘게 알아왔어요.

items.example: **I've known** him since elementary school.
**I've known** her since we worked together.

patterns.name: We have a lot in common because ~

items.example: **We have a lot in common because** we both love music.
items.translation: 우리 둘 다 음악을 좋아해서 공통점이 많아요.

items.example: **We have a lot in common because** we grew up in the same neighborhood.
**We have a lot in common because** we have similar values.
items.translation: 비슷한 가치관을 가지고 있어서 공통점이 많아요.

patterns.name: What I appreciate about + 사람 + is ~

items.example: **What I appreciate about** her is her honesty.
items.translation: 내가 그녀에 대해 고마워하는 것은 정직함이에요.

items.example: **What I appreciate about** him is that he's always there for me.
items.translation: 내가 그에 대해 고마워하는 것은 항상 곁에 있어준다는 거예요.

items.example: **What I appreciate about** my friends is their support.
items.translation: 내가 친구들에 대해 고마워하는 것은 그들의 지지예요.

patterns.name: I come from a + 형용사 + family

items.example: **I come from a** small family.
**I come from a** close-knit family.
**I come from a** multicultural family.

patterns.name: I'm the + 서수 + child in my family

items.example: **I'm the** oldest child in my family.
**I'm the** youngest of three siblings.
**I'm the** only child in my family.

patterns.name: My parents always encouraged me to ~

items.example: **My parents always encouraged me to** follow my dreams.
**My parents always encouraged me to** study hard.
**My parents always encouraged me to** be independent.
**I try to** recycle as much as possible.
**I try to** reduce my plastic usage.
**I try to** use public transportation.

patterns.name: I think we should + 환경 관련 제안

items.example: **I think we should** use renewable energy.
**I think we should** protect endangered species.
items.translation: 멸종 위기 종을 보호해야 한다고 생각해요.

items.example: **I think we should** reduce carbon emissions.

patterns.name: In the future, I hope to ~

items.example: **In the future**, I hope to travel around the world.
**In the future**, I hope to start a family.
**In the future**, I hope to live abroad.
**I'm saving up to** buy a house.
**I'm saving up to** go on a trip to Europe.
items.translation: 유럽 여행을 가기 위해 저축하고 있어요.

items.example: **I'm saving up to** buy a new car.
items.translation: 새 차를 사기 위해 저축하고 있어요.

patterns.name: My goal for this year is to ~

items.example: **My goal for this year is to** learn a new skill.
items.translation: 올해 나의 목표는 새로운 기술을 배우는 거예요.

items.example: **My goal for this year is to** read 50 books.
**My goal for this year is to** improve my English.
items.translation: 올해 나의 목표는 영어 실력 향상이에요.

items.example: **I remember** visiting my grandparents every summer.
items.translation: 매 여름 조부모님 댁에 방문했던 것을 기억해요.

items.example: **I remember** learning to ride a bike.
items.translation: 자전거 타는 법 배웠던 것을 기억해요.

items.example: **I remember** my first day at school.
**Looking back**, I realize that it was a valuable experience.
**Looking back**, I realize that I've grown a lot.
**Looking back**, I realize that I made the right decision.

patterns.name: That was when I first + 과거형

items.example: **That was when I first** realized my passion for cooking.
items.translation: 그때 처음으로 요리에 대한 열정을 깨달았어요.

items.example: **That was when I first** met my best friend.
items.translation: 그때 처음으로 가장 친한 친구를 만났어요.

items.example: **That was when I first** experienced culture shock.
**I feel** happy when I spend time with my family.
**I feel** stressed when I have too much work.
items.translation: 일이 너무 많을 때 스트레스를 받아요.

items.example: **I feel** excited when I travel to new places.
**What makes me** happy is achieving my goals.
items.translation: 나를 행복하게 만드는 것은 목표 달성이에요.

items.example: **What makes me** angry is unfairness.
**What makes me** proud is helping others.
items.translation: 나를 자랑스럽게 만드는 것은 다른 사람을 돕는 거예요.

patterns.name: I can't help but feel + 감정

items.example: **I can't help but feel** nervous before presentations.
items.translation: 발표 전에 긴장이 되지 않을 수 없어요.

items.example: **I can't help but feel** grateful for this opportunity.
items.translation: 이 기회에 감사하지 않을 수 없어요.

items.example: **I can't help but feel** nostalgic when I hear this song.
items.translation: 이 노래를 들으면 향수를 느끼지 않을 수 없어요.

items.example: **In my opinion**, education is the key to success.
**In my opinion**, working from home has many benefits.
items.translation: 내 의견으로는 재택근무에 많은 장점이 있어요.

items.example: **In my opinion**, social media has both pros and cons.
items.translation: 내 의견으로는 소셜 미디어에는 장단점이 있어요.

items.example: **From my perspective**, experience is more valuable than degrees.
items.translation: 내 관점에서 경험이 학위보다 더 가치 있어요.

items.example: **From my perspective**, teamwork is essential in any job.
items.translation: 내 관점에서 어떤 직업에서든 팀워크가 필수예요.

items.example: **From my perspective**, balance is important in life.
**I strongly believe that** hard work pays off.
**I strongly believe that** everyone deserves respect.
items.translation: 나는 모든 사람이 존중받을 자격이 있다고 강하게 믿어요.

items.example: **I strongly believe that** communication is key in relationships.
items.translation: 나는 관계에서 소통이 핵심이라고 강하게 믿어요.

items.example: **Would you mind** helping me with this?
**Would you mind** speaking more slowly?
items.translation: 좀 더 천천히 말씀해 주실 수 있을까요?

items.example: **Would you mind** closing the window?
**Could you possibly** lend me your car?
items.translation: 혹시 차 좀 빌려주실 수 있을까요?

items.example: **Could you possibly** give me a ride?
**Could you possibly** call me back later?
items.translation: 혹시 나중에 다시 전화해 주실 수 있을까요?

patterns.name: I was wondering if you could ~

items.example: **I was wondering if you could** help me move.
items.translation: 이사 좀 도와주실 수 있을지 궁금해서요.

items.example: **I was wondering if you could** review my report.
items.translation: 제 보고서 검토해 주실 수 있을지 궁금해서요.

items.example: **I was wondering if you could** recommend a good restaurant.
items.translation: 좋은 식당 추천해 주실 수 있을지 궁금해서요.

items.example: **Compared to** last year, this year has been more challenging.
**Compared to** coffee, tea is healthier.
**Compared to** driving, taking the subway is faster.
**While** some prefer working alone, I enjoy teamwork.
items.translation: 혼자 일하는 것을 선호하는 사람도 있지만, 저는 팀워크를 즐겨요.

items.example: **While** books are traditional, e-books are more convenient.
items.translation: 종이책이 전통적인 반면, 전자책이 더 편리해요.

items.example: **While** it's expensive, the quality is worth it.
items.translation: 비싸긴 하지만, 품질이 그만한 가치가 있어요.

patterns.name: The main difference between A and B is ~

items.example: The main difference between the two is the price.
The main difference between living alone and with family is independence.
items.translation: 혼자 사는 것과 가족과 사는 것의 주요 차이점은 독립성이에요.

items.example: The main difference between these two jobs is the work-life balance.
items.translation: 이 두 직업의 주요 차이점은 일과 삶의 균형이에요.

items.example: **It's a place where** you can relax and enjoy nature.
items.translation: 그곳은 휴식하고 자연을 즐길 수 있는 장소예요.

items.example: **It's a place where** people gather to socialize.
**It's a place where** I feel most comfortable.
items.translation: 그곳은 내가 가장 편안하게 느끼는 장소예요.

patterns.name: The thing I like most about ~ is ~

items.example: **The thing I like most about** my city is the food scene.
items.translation: 내 도시에서 가장 좋은 점은 음식 문화예요.

items.example: **The thing I like most about** my job is the people.
items.translation: 내 직업에서 가장 좋은 점은 사람들이에요.

items.example: **The thing I like most about** summer is the long days.
items.translation: 여름에서 가장 좋은 점은 긴 낮이에요.

items.example: **What sets** this restaurant apart is the unique atmosphere.
items.translation: 이 레스토랑을 특별하게 만드는 것은 독특한 분위기예요.

items.example: **What sets** this product apart is its durability.
items.translation: 이 제품을 특별하게 만드는 것은 내구성이에요.

items.example: **What sets** Korean food apart is the variety of side dishes.
items.translation: 한국 음식을 특별하게 만드는 것은 다양한 반찬이에요.

items.example: **I'm used to** waking up early.
**I'm used to** working under pressure.
**I'm used to** living alone.
**I'm not used to** the cold weather here.
**I'm not used to** speaking in public.
items.translation: 대중 앞에서 말하는 것에 익숙하지 않아요.

items.example: **I'm not used to** eating spicy food.
items.translation: 매운 음식 먹는 것에 익숙하지 않아요.

patterns.name: It takes me + 시간 + to + 동사

items.example: **It takes me** about 30 minutes to get to work.
**It takes me** an hour to cook dinner.
items.translation: 저녁 요리하는 데 한 시간 걸려요.

items.example: **It takes me** a while to fall asleep.
**I ended up** buying more than I planned.
items.translation: 결국 계획보다 더 많이 사게 됐어요.

items.example: **I ended up** staying home all weekend.
items.translation: 결국 주말 내내 집에 있게 됐어요.

items.example: **I ended up** changing my plans.
**I'm thinking about** taking a vacation.
items.translation: 휴가를 가는 것에 대해 생각 중이에요.

items.example: **I'm thinking about** learning a new language.
items.translation: 새 언어를 배우는 것에 대해 생각 중이에요.

items.example: **I'm thinking about** moving to a bigger apartment.
items.translation: 더 큰 아파트로 이사하는 것에 대해 생각 중이에요.

items.example: **I look forward to** seeing you again.
**I look forward to** hearing from you.
**I look forward to** the weekend.
**As far as I know**, the meeting is still on.
items.translation: 내가 아는 한, 회의는 아직 진행 예정이에요.

items.example: **As far as I know**, he's on vacation this week.
items.translation: 내가 아는 한, 그는 이번 주에 휴가 중이에요.

items.example: **As far as I know**, the store closes at 9 PM.
items.translation: 내가 아는 한, 그 가게는 밤 9시에 닫아요.

items.example: **To be honest**, I'm not sure about that.
items.translation: 솔직히 말하면, 그것에 대해 잘 모르겠어요.

items.example: **To be honest**, I prefer working from home.
**To be honest**, I wasn't expecting that.
**It's worth** trying the local food.
**It's worth** watching that documentary.
**It's worth** investing time in learning new skills.
items.translation: 새로운 기술을 배우는 데 시간을 투자할 가치가 있어요.

items.example: **I can't imagine** living without my phone.
items.translation: 폰 없이 사는 것을 상상할 수 없어요.

items.example: **I can't imagine** working a job I don't enjoy.
items.translation: 즐기지 못하는 일을 하는 것을 상상할 수 없어요.

items.example: **I can't imagine** not having weekends off.
items.translation: 주말에 쉬지 못하는 것을 상상할 수 없어요.

items.example: **I should have** studied harder.
**I should have** brought an umbrella.
**I should have** left earlier.
**I wish I could** travel more often.
items.translation: 더 자주 여행할 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

items.example: **I wish I could** speak more languages.
items.translation: 더 많은 언어를 할 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

items.example: **I wish I could** play a musical instrument.

patterns.name: If I had + 과거분사, I would have + 과거분사

items.example: **If I had** known earlier, I would have helped.
**If I had** more time, I would have finished the project.
items.translation: 시간이 더 있었다면, 프로젝트를 끝냈을 텐데요.

items.example: **If I had** studied abroad, I would have improved my English faster.
items.translation: 유학을 갔다면, 영어가 더 빨리 늘었을 텐데요.

items.example: **The reason why** I wake up early is because I have a long commute.
items.translation: 일찍 일어나는 이유는 출퇴근 시간이 길기 때문이에요.

items.example: **The reason why** I chose this career is because I'm passionate about it.
items.translation: 이 직업을 선택한 이유는 열정이 있기 때문이에요.

items.example: **The reason why** I exercise is because it makes me feel better.
**Not only** is it affordable, but also high quality.
**Not only** does he speak English, but also Japanese.
**Not only** is she smart, but also very kind.
items.translation: 그녀는 똑똒할 뿐만 아니라 매우 친절해요.

items.example: **It's no wonder** you're tired after such a long day.
items.translation: 긴 하루 후에 피곤한 건 당연해요.

items.example: **It's no wonder** she got the promotion.
**It's no wonder** the restaurant is always full.
items.translation: 그 식당이 항상 꽉 찬 건 당연해요.

items.example: **I tend to** overwork when I'm stressed.
**I tend to** be more productive in the morning.
**I tend to** forget things when I'm busy.
items.translation: 바쁠 때 물건을 잊어버리는 경향이 있어요.

patterns.name: I'm in the habit of + 동명사

items.example: **I'm in the habit of** checking my phone first thing in the morning.
items.translation: 아침에 제일 먼저 폰을 확인하는 습관이 있어요.

items.example: **I'm in the habit of** taking notes during meetings.
**I'm in the habit of** reading before bed.
items.translation: 자기 전에 책 읽는 습관이 있어요.

patterns.name: I've gotten into the habit of + 동명사

items.example: **I've gotten into the habit of** waking up at 6 AM.
**I've gotten into the habit of** meal prepping on Sundays.
**I've gotten into the habit of** walking after dinner.
items.translation: 저녁 식사 후 걷는 습관이 생겼어요.

items.example: **You should definitely** try the local food.
**You should definitely** visit that museum.
**You should definitely** watch that movie.

patterns.name: If I were you, I would + 동사원형

items.example: **If I were you**, I would take that job offer.
items.translation: 내가 너라면, 그 취업 제안을 받을 거야.

items.example: **If I were you**, I would talk to him directly.
items.translation: 내가 너라면, 그에게 직접 얘기할 거야.

items.example: **If I were you**, I would save more money.
items.translation: 내가 너라면, 돈을 더 저축할 거야.

items.example: **Why don't you** take a break?
**Why don't you** ask for help?
**Why don't you** try a different approach?
**You might want to** double-check the numbers.
items.translation: 숫자를 다시 확인하는 게 좋을 수도 있어요.

items.example: **You might want to** bring a jacket.
items.translation: 재킷을 가져오는 게 좋을 수도 있어요.

items.example: **You might want to** leave early to avoid traffic.
items.translation: 교통 체증을 피하려면 일찍 출발하는 게 좋을 수도 있어요.

items.example: **I highly recommend** visiting in the spring.
**I highly recommend** taking that course.
items.translation: 그 강의를 듣는 것을 강력히 추천해요.

items.example: **I highly recommend** trying their signature dish.
items.translation: 그들의 시그니처 요리를 먹어보는 것을 강력히 추천해요.

patterns.name: It would be better to + 동사원형

items.example: **It would be better to** wait until tomorrow.
items.translation: 내일까지 기다리는 게 더 좋을 거예요.

items.example: **It would be better to** discuss this in person.
items.translation: 이것을 직접 만나서 논의하는 게 더 좋을 거예요.

items.example: **It would be better to** be prepared.
items.translation: 준비하고 있는 게 더 좋을 거예요.

items.example: **The problem is that** we don't have enough time.
**The problem is that** the budget is limited.
**The problem is that** I can't find my keys.
items.translation: 문제는 열쇠를 찾을 수 없다는 거예요.

patterns.name: What we need to do is ~

items.example: **What we need to do is** come up with a new plan.
items.translation: 우리가 해야 할 것은 새로운 계획을 세우는 거예요.

items.example: **What we need to do is** work together.
items.translation: 우리가 해야 할 것은 함께 일하는 거예요.

items.example: **What we need to do is** prioritize our tasks.
items.translation: 우리가 해야 할 것은 업무의 우선순위를 정하는 거예요.

patterns.name: One way to solve this is to + 동사원형

items.example: **One way to solve this is to** communicate better.
items.translation: 이것을 해결하는 한 가지 방법은 더 잘 소통하는 거예요.

items.example: **One way to solve this is to** hire more staff.
items.translation: 이것을 해결하는 한 가지 방법은 더 많은 직원을 채용하는 거예요.

items.example: **One way to solve this is to** use technology.
items.translation: 이것을 해결하는 한 가지 방법은 기술을 활용하는 거예요.

patterns.name: I figured out how to + 동사원형

items.example: **I figured out how to** fix the problem.
**I figured out how to** use this software.
**I figured out how to** get there faster.
**It turned out that** I was wrong.
**It turned out that** the solution was simple.
**It turned out that** we had the same idea.
items.translation: 알고 보니 우리가 같은 생각을 했어요.

patterns.name: Ever since + 시점, I have + 과거분사

items.example: **Ever since** I moved here, I have been happier.
items.translation: 여기로 이사한 이후로 쭉 더 행복해요.

items.example: **Ever since** I started exercising, I have felt healthier.
items.translation: 운동을 시작한 이후로 쭉 더 건강해요.

items.example: **Ever since** I got a new job, I have been busier.
items.translation: 새 직장을 얻은 이후로 쭉 더 바빠요.

items.example: **It's been** five years since I graduated.
**It's been** a while since we last met.
**It's been** two months since I started this project.
items.translation: 이 프로젝트를 시작한 지 두 달 됐어요.

items.example: **By the time** I got there, everyone had left.
**By the time** I finish this, it will be midnight.
**By the time** you read this, I'll be on the plane.
items.translation: 이것을 읽을 때쯤에는 나는 비행기에 있을 거예요.

items.example: **As soon as** I get home, I'll call you.
**As soon as** the meeting ends, let's grab coffee.
**As soon as** I heard the news, I rushed over.
**Before I knew it**, the year was over.
**Before I knew it**, my kids grew up.
**Before I knew it**, I had finished the whole book.
**Sooner or later**, you'll find the right person.
**Sooner or later**, things will get better.
**Sooner or later**, we'll have to make a decision.
**I'm good at** solving puzzles.
**I'm good at** multitasking.
**I'm good at** remembering names.

patterns.name: I'm not very good at + 동명사

items.example: **I'm not very good at** drawing.
items.translation: 나는 그림 그리는 것을 잘 못해요.

items.example: **I'm not very good at** giving speeches.
**I'm not very good at** cooking complicated dishes.
**I've learned how to** manage my time better.
items.translation: 시간을 더 잘 관리하는 법을 배웠어요.

items.example: **I've learned how to** code.
**I've learned how to** deal with stress.

patterns.name: I'm trying to improve my + 명사

items.example: **I'm trying to improve my** English speaking skills.
**I'm trying to improve my** communication skills.
**I'm trying to improve my** fitness level.
**I have experience in** project management.
**I have experience in** teaching English.
**I have experience in** customer service.
**Things have changed since** I was young.
items.translation: 내가 어렸을 때 이후로 상황이 변했어요.

items.example: **Things have changed since** we started working remotely.
**Things have changed since** the pandemic.

patterns.name: I used to + 동사원형, but now I ~

items.example: **I used to** drink coffee, but now I prefer tea.
items.translation: 예전에는 커피를 마셨는데, 지금은 차를 선호해요.

items.example: **I used to** be shy, but now I'm more outgoing.
**I used to** live in Seoul, but now I live in Busan.
items.translation: 예전에는 서울에 살았는데, 지금은 부산에 살아요.

items.example: Technology has become essential in our lives.
Online shopping has become very popular.
My schedule has become busier lately.
**I'm getting used to** the new system.
**I'm getting used to** living in a big city.
**I'm getting used to** working from home.
**I've noticed that** prices have gone up.
**I've noticed that** people are more health-conscious.
items.translation: 사람들이 더 건강에 신경 쓴다는 걸 알게 됐어요.

items.example: **I've noticed that** the neighborhood has changed a lot.
items.translation: 동네가 많이 바뀌었다는 걸 알게 됐어요.

items.example: **I've decided to** quit my job.
**I've decided to** go back to school.
**I've decided to** start a new hobby.

patterns.name: I had to choose between A and B

items.example: I had to choose between family and career.
I had to choose between two great job offers.
items.translation: 두 개의 좋은 취업 제안 사이에서 선택해야 했어요.

items.example: I had to choose between saving money and traveling.
**It depends on** my schedule.
**It depends on** the weather.
**It depends on** how much time I have.

patterns.name: After careful consideration, I decided to ~

items.example: **After careful consideration**, I decided to accept the offer.
items.translation: 신중한 고려 끝에 제안을 수락하기로 결정했어요.

items.example: **After careful consideration**, I decided to stay in my current job.
items.translation: 신중한 고려 끝에 현재 직장에 머무르기로 결정했어요.

items.example: **After careful consideration**, I decided to move abroad.
items.translation: 신중한 고려 끝에 해외로 이사하기로 결정했어요.

items.example: **I ended up choosing** the cheaper option.
items.translation: 결국 더 저렴한 옵션을 선택하게 됐어요.

items.example: **I ended up choosing** to stay home.
**I ended up choosing** a different career path.

patterns.name: I'm the kind of person who ~

items.example: **I'm the kind of person who** likes to plan ahead.
items.translation: 나는 미리 계획하는 것을 좋아하는 종류의 사람이에요.

items.example: **I'm the kind of person who** enjoys trying new things.
items.translation: 나는 새로운 것을 시도하는 것을 즐기는 종류의 사람이에요.

items.example: **I'm the kind of person who** values honesty.
items.translation: 나는 정직함을 소중히 여기는 종류의 사람이에요.

items.example: **I consider myself** a hard worker.
items.translation: 나는 스스로를 열심히 일하는 사람이라고 생각해요.

items.example: **I consider myself** an optimist.
**I consider myself** a good listener.
items.translation: 나는 스스로를 경청을 잘하는 사람이라고 생각해요.

patterns.name: People often say that I'm + 형용사

items.example: **People often say that I'm** friendly.
**People often say that I'm** patient.
items.translation: 사람들이 종종 나를 인내심이 있다고 말해요.

items.example: **People often say that I'm** organized.
**One of my strengths is** problem-solving.
items.translation: 나의 장점 중 하나는 문제 해결이에요.

items.example: **One of my strengths is** being able to work under pressure.
items.translation: 나의 장점 중 하나는 압박감 속에서 일할 수 있다는 거예요.

items.example: **One of my strengths is** communication.
**I'd describe myself as** ambitious.
items.translation: 나를 야망 있는 사람으로 묘사할 거예요.

items.example: **I'd describe myself as** a team player.
**I'd describe myself as** easy-going.
**It's located in** the city center.
**It's located in** a quiet neighborhood.
It's located near the subway station.
**It's about** 30 minutes from my home.
**It's about** a 10-minute walk from here.
**It's about** an hour's drive from the city.

patterns.name: You can get there by + 교통수단

items.example: **You can get there by** subway.
**You can get there by** bus or taxi.
items.translation: 버스나 택시로 거기 갈 수 있어요.

items.example: **You can get there by** walking.
**It's right next to** the coffee shop.
**It's right next to** my office.
**It's right next to** the main entrance.
**It's across from** the park.
**It's across from** the bank.
**It's across from** the school.

patterns.name: I love the way + 주어 + 동사

items.example: **I love the way** my mom cooks.
**I love the way** this restaurant seasons their meat.
items.translation: 이 식당이 고기에 양념하는 방식이 정말 좋아요.

items.example: **I love the way** they present the dishes.
items.translation: 그들이 요리를 담아내는 방식이 정말 좋아요.

items.example: **It tastes like** chicken.
**It tastes like** homemade food.
**It tastes like** something my grandmother used to make.
items.translation: 할머니가 만들어 주셨던 것 같은 맛이 나요.

patterns.name: I'm a big fan of + 음식

items.example: **I'm a big fan of** Korean BBQ.
**I'm a big fan of** spicy food.
**I'm a big fan of** seafood.

patterns.name: I'm not a picky eater, but I don't like ~

items.example: **I'm not a picky eater**, but I don't like raw fish.
**I'm not a picky eater**, but I don't like bitter vegetables.
items.translation: 나는 까다롭지 않은데, 쓴 채소는 싫어요.

items.example: **I'm not a picky eater**, but I don't like overly sweet desserts.
items.translation: 나는 까다롭지 않은데, 너무 단 디저트는 싫어요.

items.example: **My go**-to dish is pasta.
**My go**-to dish is bibimbap when I'm in a hurry.
items.translation: 바쁠 때 자주 먹는 요리는 비빔밥이에요.

items.example: **My go**-to dish is chicken soup when I'm sick.
items.translation: 아플 때 자주 먹는 요리는 치킨 수프예요.

patterns.name: I usually cook at home because ~

items.example: **I usually cook at home because** it's healthier.
items.translation: 보통 집에서 요리하는데, 더 건강하기 때문이에요.

items.example: **I usually cook at home because** it saves money.
items.translation: 보통 집에서 요리하는데, 돈이 절약되기 때문이에요.

items.example: **I usually cook at home because** I enjoy it.
items.translation: 보통 집에서 요리하는데, 그것을 즐기기 때문이에요.

items.example: **I usually commute by** subway.
**I usually commute by** car.
**I usually commute by** bike when the weather is nice.
items.translation: 날씨가 좋을 때 보통 자전거로 출퇴근해요.

patterns.name: It takes about + 시간 + to get to ~

items.example: **It takes about** an hour to get to work.
items.translation: 출근하는 데 약 한 시간 걸려요.

items.example: **It takes about** 20 minutes to get to the airport.
**It takes about** 2 hours to get to Busan by KTX.
items.translation: KTX로 부산에 가는 데 약 2시간 걸려요.

items.example: **The traffic is usually** heavy during rush hour.
**The traffic is usually** light on weekends.
**The traffic is usually** terrible on Friday evenings.
**I prefer** public transportation because it's more convenient.
**I prefer** driving because I have more flexibility.
**I prefer** walking because I can enjoy the fresh air.
items.translation: 신선한 공기를 즐길 수 있어서 걷는 것을 선호해요.

patterns.name: The easiest way to get there is by ~

items.example: **The easiest way to get there is by** subway.
items.translation: 거기 가는 가장 쉬운 방법은 지하철이에요.

items.example: **The easiest way to get there is by** taking a taxi.
items.translation: 거기 가는 가장 쉬운 방법은 택시를 타는 거예요.

items.example: **The easiest way to get there is by** using a navigation app.
items.translation: 거기 가는 가장 쉬운 방법은 내비게이션 앱을 사용하는 거예요.

items.example: **I can't live without** my smartphone.
**I can't live without** the internet.
**I can't live without** my laptop.

patterns.name: I spend + 시간 + on + 디지털 활동

items.example: **I spend** about two hours on social media every day.
items.translation: 매일 소셜 미디어에 약 두 시간을 보내요.

items.example: **I spend** a lot of time on streaming services.
**I spend** most of my free time watching YouTube.
items.translation: 대부분의 여가 시간을 유튜브 보는 데 보내요.

patterns.name: I mainly use my phone for + 동명사

items.example: **I mainly use my phone for** checking messages.
items.translation: 나는 주로 메시지 확인하는 데 폰을 사용해요.

items.example: **I mainly use my phone for** taking photos.
items.translation: 나는 주로 사진 찍는 데 폰을 사용해요.

items.example: **I mainly use my phone for** navigation.
items.translation: 나는 주로 길 찾는 데 폰을 사용해요.

items.example: **One advantage of** online shopping is convenience.
items.translation: 온라인 쇼핑의 장점 중 하나는 편리함이에요.

items.example: **One advantage of** working remotely is flexibility.
**One advantage of** video calls is saving time on commuting.
items.translation: 화상 통화의 장점 중 하나는 출퇴근 시간을 아끼는 거예요.

patterns.name: I try to limit my screen time because ~

items.example: **I try to limit my screen time because** it affects my sleep.
items.translation: 수면에 영향을 미쳐서 스크린 타임을 제한하려고 해요.

items.example: **I try to limit my screen time because** I want to spend more time outdoors.
items.translation: 밖에서 더 많은 시간을 보내고 싶어서 스크린 타임을 제한하려고 해요.

items.example: **I try to limit my screen time because** it strains my eyes.

patterns.name: I'm on a tight budget, so ~

items.example: **I'm on a tight budget**, so I cook at home.
**I'm on a tight budget**, so I avoid eating out.
**I'm on a tight budget**, so I look for discounts.

patterns.name: I try to save money by + 동명사

items.example: **I try to save money by** bringing lunch to work.
items.translation: 점심 도시락을 싸감으로써 돈을 아끼려고 해요.

items.example: **I try to save money by** using coupons.
**I try to save money by** buying things on sale.
items.translation: 세일할 때 사함으로써 돈을 아끼려고 해요.

patterns.name: It's expensive, but it's worth it because ~

items.example: **It's expensive**, but it's worth it because the quality is great.
items.translation: 비싸지만, 품질이 좋아서 그만한 가치가 있어요.

items.example: **It's expensive**, but it's worth it because it lasts long.
items.translation: 비싸지만, 오래 가서 그만한 가치가 있어요.

items.example: **It's expensive**, but it's worth it because it saves time.
items.translation: 비싸지만, 시간을 절약해서 그만한 가치가 있어요.

patterns.name: I've been saving up for + 목표

items.example: **I've been saving up for** a trip to Europe.
**I've been saving up for** my wedding.
**I've been saving up for** a new car.

patterns.name: The cost of living has + 동사(과거분사)

items.example: **The cost of living has** gone up significantly.
**The cost of living has** increased over the years.
**The cost of living has** become a concern.

patterns.name: I make sure to + 건강 습관

items.example: **I make sure to** drink enough water every day.
**I make sure to** get at least 7 hours of sleep.
**I make sure to** take breaks from my computer.

patterns.name: My doctor recommended that I + 동사원형

items.example: **My doctor recommended that I** exercise more.

**My doctor recommended that I** eat more vegetables.

patterns.name: I've been feeling + 건강 상태 + lately

items.example: **I've been feeling** tired lately.
**I've been feeling** more energetic lately.
**I've been feeling** under the weather lately.

patterns.name: I started + 건강 활동 + to improve my health

items.example: **I started** yoga to improve my flexibility.
**I started** meditating to reduce stress.
**I started** running to lose weight.

patterns.name: What works for me is + 건강 방법

items.example: **What works for me is** getting regular exercise.
items.translation: 나에게 효과가 있는 건 규칙적인 운동이에요.

items.example: **What works for me is** avoiding caffeine after 6 PM.
items.translation: 나에게 효과가 있는 건 오후 6시 이후 카페인 피하기예요.

items.example: **What works for me is** meal prepping on weekends.
items.translation: 나에게 효과가 있는 건 주말에 식사 준비하기예요.

items.example: **I'm dying to visit** Japan.
**I'm dying to visit** the Grand Canyon.
**I'm dying to visit** Iceland.

patterns.name: The highlight of my trip was + 경험

items.example: **The highlight of my trip was** seeing the sunset at the beach.
items.translation: 여행의 하이라이트는 해변에서 노을을 본 거예요.

items.example: **The highlight of my trip was** meeting the locals.

items.example: **I prefer traveling** alone because I can go at my own pace.
items.translation: 내 속도대로 갈 수 있어서 혼자 여행하는 것을 선호해요.

items.example: **I prefer traveling** with friends because it's more fun.
items.translation: 더 재미있어서 친구들과 여행하는 것을 선호해요.

items.example: **I prefer traveling** by train because I can enjoy the scenery.
items.translation: 경치를 즐길 수 있어서 기차로 여행하는 것을 선호해요.

patterns.meaning: 여행할 때 항상 하는 한 가지는 ~야

items.example: **One thing I always do when traveling is** take lots of photos.
items.translation: 여행할 때 항상 하는 한 가지는 사진을 많이 찍는 거예요.

items.example: **One thing I always do when traveling is** visit the local markets.
items.translation: 여행할 때 항상 하는 한 가지는 현지 시장을 방문하는 거예요.

patterns.name: I would love to go back to + 장소 + because ~

items.example: **I would love to go back to** Jeju because the beaches are beautiful.
items.translation: 해변이 아름다워서 제주에 다시 가고 싶어요.

items.example: **I would love to go back to** Paris because there's so much to see.
items.translation: 볼 것이 너무 많아서 파리에 다시 가고 싶어요.

items.example: **I would love to go back to** Thailand because the food was amazing.
items.translation: 음식이 훌륭해서 태국에 다시 가고 싶어요.

items.example: **I really appreciate** your help.

**I really appreciate** your understanding.
**Thank you for** listening.
**Thank you for** being patient.
**Thank you for** inviting me.
**I'm grateful for** my family.
**I'm grateful for** this opportunity.
**I'm grateful for** good health.
**I apologize for** being late.
**I apologize for** the misunderstanding.
**I apologize for** any inconvenience.

items.example: **I didn't mean to** be rude.

**I totally agree with** you.
**I totally agree with** that idea.
**I totally agree with** what you said.
**I see your point**, but I think there's another way.
items.translation: 당신 말 이해하지만, 다른 방법이 있다고 생각해요.

items.translation: 그게 정확히 내가 말하고 싶었던 거예요.

items.translation: 틀릴 수도 있지만, 그가 부산 출신인 것 같아요.

items.example: The movie exceeded my expectations.

The results exceeded my expectations.
**Instead of** driving, I took the subway.
